117.title: "The Fable of the Sap Who Listened Ahead"
117.author: TAD
notes: Brief essay on the life of the cartoonist, with a half-page illustration.

118.heading: Cartoonists.
118.title: Flight of Magic
118.author: Jacqueline Diamond.
notes: "What was the quintessential high-powered businesswoman doing with a laid-back cartoonist who'd lampooned her in a nationally syndicated comic strip? Eating Larry Toland's gooey desserts. Enjoying him in his role as the neighborhood Pied Piper. And wondering what it would be like to fall in love. Beth Macon was at home in a business suit. At her best when closing a deal. And at a total loss when it came to romance. Even if Beth found the time, could she learn to let go and surrender to the passion she saw in Larry's eyes?"
